result.text: China was shocked by recent statements of Israeli officials about the use of nuclear weapons in the Gaza Strip and urged Israeli officials to retract these statements, said China's deputy permanent representative to the UN Geng Shuang on Monday at the fourth session of the Conference on the Establishment of a Middle East Zone Free of Nuclear Weapons and other Weapons of Mass Destruction.

legacy.description:
Secretary-General of the @UN.

We will never, ever give up making this world better for everyone, everywhere.
legacy.name: António Guterres

result.text:
Today, the @UN family observed a moment of silence to mourn & honour our colleagues killed in Gaza.

Since the start of this conflict, more than 100 @UNRWA staff have lost their lives - the highest number of UN aid workers killed in a conflict in such a short time.

They will never be forgotten.

I join Secretary-General @antonioguterres in paying tribute to the 101 @UNRWA staff who have lost their lives in #Gaza. The safety of UN staff and humanitarian workers must be guaranteed.

The reality is China has solved the energy crisis and potentially slowed global warming. Now…

legacy.description:
M.A.
American in China, Published Author, Radio Show Host, Podcaster & Media Commentator. Opinions are my own.
legacy.name: Jason Smith - 上官杰文

result.text:
I fixed it for you WSJ.

The reality is China has solved the energy crisis and potentially slowed global warming. Now low and middle income countries can afford to install solar instead of polluting gas and coal.

Instead of seeing massive production of solar power, MAKING IT THE MOST AFFORDABLE POWER ON THE PLANET, during the most important crisis in the history of our species, WSJ twists China's success into 'causing global glut?' 

History will thank China, and this article will look like a laughable footnote on the desperate cries of a rich old man's newspaper.

#Climatestrike #Solar
https://t.co/6qdHruk0rP
